title: Drawing, "Exterior, Frederick Crace and Son Establishment, 14 Wigmore Street, London", 1827–40
medium: Graphite, brush and watercolor on paper
signed: Signed in graphite, lower left: T. Hosmer Shepherd.
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, lower right: Fredk Crace reside there from 1827-1840; lower center: Mr. Crace's house - 14 Wigmore at Cavendish square.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Horizontal rectangle. Exterior of three buildings, the central one bearing the Crace name over the entrance and on the two windows on the lower floor. The second story balcony bears the royal arms. Carriage-maker's Establishment, left (Davies and Son): "Glass shade-warehouse," right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Exterior, Frederick Crace and Son Establishment, 14 Wigmore Street, London", 1827–40.
1827–40. Graphite, brush and watercolor on paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-98.
